title: Cape Cod National Seashore: Multimedia Presentations
body: Multimedia Presentations       The Two-Column Aerosol Project at Cape Cod National Seashore Funded by the Department of Energy's (DOE) Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility Link to these short presentations:   Weather Balloon Launch A Tour of Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility                        Heather Goldstone, from NPR station WCAI in Woods Hole, Massachusetts, interviews Dr. Larry Berg, scientist at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory and principal investigator of the Two-Column Aerosol Campaign (TCAP). TCAP is a DOE-sponsored field campaign that took place from July 2012 to June 2013.  Duration:8 minutes, 41 seconds                 Old Harbor Life-Saving Station   Enjoy two short films about Old Harbor Life-Saving Station in Provincetown, and the U.S. Life-Saving Service.   An Introduction to the U.S. Life-Saving Service Life and Service of a Surfman   The Threatened Piping Plover   A Photo Essay  Seals at Cape Cod National Seashore Seals reside within the waters of Cape Cod National Seashore.   Enjoy this brief introduction to one of our interesting inhabitants.  Frog Call Recordings at Cape Cod National Seashore   Listen to some of the night sounds you can experience at Cape Cod National Seashore.   The Cape Codcast - An audio series exploring science at the Cape Cod National Seashore   East Harbor Salt Marsh Restoration - Plant Ecologist, Dr. Steve Smith takes us on a journey to East Harbor; a former salt marsh undergoing restoration via the reintroduction of salt water from Cape Cod Bay. Geomorphic Shoreline Change - A joint project between the National Park Service and the Provincetown Center for Coastal Studies examining how the coast of Cape Cod is changing over time. Spadefoot Toads at CCNS - Take a ride on a rainy night to the Province Lands and discover the elusive spadefoot toad with Wildlife Ecologist Bob Cook and researcher Brad Timm. Listen to a spring chorus of Fowler's toads and spring peepers. This recording was made on a May evening in 2009 at the Hatches Harbor Fire Road. Dr. Todd Tupper discusses amphibian ecology and his dissertation pertaining to Fowler's toads. Watch Video! Video courtesy of Mark Adams Listen to a spring chorus of grey treefrogs, green frogs, and bull frogs. This recording was made in late June 2010 at a small pond in the Eastham Woods.  Virtual introductions to Cape Cod National Seashore's self-guiding trails (short .wmv files)  Red Maple Swamp Trail, Eastham Fort Hill Trail, Eastham Nauset Marsh, Trail, Eastham Atlantic White Cedar Swamp Trail, Wellfleet Great Island Trail, Wellfleet Pamet Area Trails, Truro Small's Swamp Trail, Truro Pilgrim Springs, Provincetown Beech Forest Trail, Provincetown  NOAA Ocean Today website films   Connecting Us to Nature Protecting Marine Life Discovering the Ocean's Secrets Sustaining Communities
